section.title: tls.force_run
section.para: force loading the tls module even when initial sanity checks fail.

section.title: tls.method
section.para: TLS method used (TLSv1, SSLv3, SSLv2, SSLv23).

section.title: tls.verify_certificate
section.para: if enabled the certificates will be verified.

section.title: tls.verify_depth
section.para: sets how far up the certificate chain will the certificate verification go in the search for a trusted CA.

section.title: tls.require_certificate
section.para: if enabled a certificate will be required from clients.

section.title: tls.private_key
section.para: name of the file containing the private key (pem format), if not contained in the certificate file.

section.title: tls.ca_list
section.para: name of the file containing the trusted CA list (pem format).

section.title: tls.crl
section.para: name of the file containing the CRL (certificare revocation list in pem format).

section.title: tls.certificate
section.para: name of the file containing the certificate (pem format).

section.title: tls.cipher_list
section.para: list of the accepted ciphers (strings separated by colons).

section.title: tls.session_cache
section.para: enables or disables the session cache.

section.title: tls.session_id
section.para: string used for the session id.

section.title: tls.config
section.para: tls config file name (used for the per domain options).

section.title: tls.disable_compression
section.para: if set disable the built-in OpenSSL compression.

section.title: tls.ssl_release_buffers
section.para: quickly release internal OpenSSL read or write buffers. Works only for OpenSSL >= 1.0..

section.title: tls.ssl_free_list_max
section.para: maximum number of free/cached memory chunks that OpenSSL will keep per connection. Works only for OpenSSL >= 1.0..

section.title: tls.ssl_max_send_fragment
section.para: sets the maximum number of bytes (clear text) send into one TLS record. Valid values are between 512 and 16384. Works only for OpenSSL >= 0.9.9.

section.title: tls.ssl_read_ahead
section.para: Enables read ahead, reducing the number of BIO read calls done internally by the OpenSSL library. Note that in newer tls module versions it is better to have read ahead disabled, since everything it is buffered in memory anyway.

section.title: tls.low_mem_threshold1
section.para: sets the minimum amount of free memory for accepting new TLS connections (KB).

section.title: tls.low_mem_threshold2
section.para: sets the minimum amount of free memory after which no more TLS operations will be attempted (even on existing connections).

section.title: tls.ct_wq_max
section.para: maximum bytes queued globally for write when write has to wait due to TLS-level renegotiation (SSL_ERROR_WANT_READ) or initial TLS connection establishment (it is different from tcp.wq_max, which works at the TCP connection level).

section.title: tls.con_ct_wq_max
section.para: maximum bytes queued for write per connection when write has to wait due to TLS-level renegotiation (SSL_ERROR_WANT_READ) or initial TLS connection establishment (it is different from tcp.conn_wq_max, which works at the TCP connection level).

section.title: tls.ct_wq_blk_size
section.para: internal TLS pre-write (clear-text) queue minimum block size (advanced tunning or debugging for now).

section.title: tls.send_close_notify
section.para: enable/disable sending a close notify TLS shutdown alert before closing the corresponding TCP connection.Note that having it enabled has a performance impact..
